page.title: 20SPECIAL DAYS AT HORNDEAN
page.content: In Horndean, once every year, in the grounds of Cadlington House there is a carnival in aid of charity. Every year a fair comes and people set up stalls and games. There is a parade and a prize for the best float and walking party. The carnival lasts three days and on the last day there is a horse show. On November 5th there is a fair to celebrate bonfire night. A big bonfire is built and a model of Guy Fawkes placed on top. On Remembrance Day people of the village gather at the War Memorial on the village square to remember those who died in the two Great Wars. The information covering this Block has been compiled by pupils from Hart Plain, Wecock and Horndean Middle Schools and Cowplain Comprehensive School.
